Hours are worst I’ve ever seen. There is no way you can live off this pay. You have to have a second job, especially if you’re part time under, which is also very stupid. 
Overall, if this is your first job.. go for it. If not, I don’t really recommend unless you applied for full time.

review_title: Amazing co-workers and engineering managers but out of touch senior leadership
job_title: Senior App Engineer/Tech Lead in Beaverton, OR
pros:
Thousands of really smart engineers to share ideas and collaborate with.
Great benefits and competitive salary.
cons:
Nike is a very large, top-heavy corporation who shuffles around senior leadership and upper level management roles frequently.  This leads to policies that stifle engineering growth opportunity.
The pace of innovation is somewhat limited by politics and sheer size. 
Headquarters are in Beaverton, 15 miles from Portland. The commute is pretty miserable (up to an hour one way) if you want to live in the city.

pros: CULTURE: generally, it's amazing. It's the most open, liberal, & fun environment, which is surprising for a major corporation. However, I can only really speak to Brand Marketing (which tends to have its party/celebratory perks)
cons: POLITICAL GAME: It's all about who you know. Make sure you have a good mentor or boss, otherwise you'll get nowhere. Too many times I've seen the most egomaniac & fake people rise up the ladder -- because they know whose ass to kiss.

job_title: Sales Associate in New York, NY
pros:
- The discount is amazing at 40%
- Fun co-workers, everyone is outgoing for the most part
- Upbeat environment
- Provided staff uniform for work
- External events and opportunities
- Notable people come in all the time to make connections
cons: They expect for you to give top notch service, which is fine. The issue is we rely almost solely on technology and when technology doesn't work, our business doesn't work and then customers get mad at you and then it just sucks. There are some really awesome leaders who care about you growing and are there to help shape you to become a better worker but some are just there to boss you around. But I suppose that is with any job.

review_title: Great Brand, Huge Matrix, Fantasic Work/Life Balance
job_title: Director of Marketing in Beaverton, OR
pros: Fun, energy brand made up of truly intelligent people.  Work/Life Balance is not an issue and team members are encouraged to take personal work-out, fitness, hobby, family, etc. time when desired.  End of year goals are huge and all are encouraged to hit the numbers aggressively, therefore, thinking outside the box is often required.
cons: Huge matrix of people and therefore, some narrow job roles are commonplace.  You must move up to work in a broader realm or you can get 'typecast' in one area forever!  Targets are set extremely high and expected to be achieved, no matter what.  It is a complete corporate environment, therefore, you must like acronyms, corporate speak, back to back meetings...

pros: Nike always gave the teamwork vibe which I always liked. They established that we are all a team and we must be working as one. Nike truly cares for their customers in which, employees go the extra mile to make the consumer happy. The employee discount is very good as well!
cons: I do not have any cons with Nike. I guess I can only say, the only con was how good the discount was. I would be constantly buying since all the deals were so good, but like I said, there are no real cons to working for Nike.

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Beaverton, OR
pros: Culture and campus are great as is overall commitment to employees as people. Good benegits and PTO accrual. There are some great perks along the way as well.
cons: Salaries are generally somewhat below industry and achieving meaningful raises is difficult. The overall atmosphere is highly political to the point of exhaustion and moving up within the organization can be challenging if that is your goal.

review_title: You only get somewhere if you know someone
pros: Got some good experiences. Great products, fun environment.
cons: Men received far more than women - there was favoritism with pay. Unfair treatment with interviewing for promotions because of "internal affairs" with leaders and their employees. Expect to sit in the same pay band for 5 years. Other companies will pay more for the same job. Nike knows they have the name behind it and will underpay all their employees. They don't update their pay scale each year due to inflation - which is crazy.

review_title: Love it, but want more from it
pros: Young, fun, innovative, creative, and exciting company to be a part of.  Beautiful campus with great amenities (good food, 2 gyms, after-work recreational sports leagues, the opportunity to attend events and activities such as speakers, athlete appearances, etc), good corporate culture, great employees.
cons: Nike doesn't do a great job of developing talent.  Career development is pretty much up to you; not much assistance, resources, or promotions from within.   Big company, challenging to network, be connected, or find out about opportunities, and not much corporate effort put into this.

review_title: The Good, The Bad, The Ugly
job_title: Former Loyal Employee in Beaverton, OR
pros: Awesome place to work - where else are there world class fitness centers right on site with sports fields and a child daycare center?  Great health benefits, paid time off, and other perks.  Some very creative people work there. Learn more and do more faster than working at smaller sized company. Brand leader.
cons: Youth oriented culture tends to reward young, blonde, perky types or runner dudes.  Career moves depends on who you know, who you offended in your lifetime, and who's in charge for now.  Managers not held accountable for managing and developing team but for how well they manage up.

review_title: Good thing at risk of going bad.
pros:
Good benefits and generally flexible schedule is great for people with young families.  
Casual work environment and plenty of fitness facilities where most departments encourage work-life balance.
cons:
Shift in culture taking place and more people seem completely focused on career advancement without regard for the people in their way.  Some groups are starting to lose that work/life balance.

Career development is almost entirely up to the individual since very few managers actually manage their teams.

pros: Lots of great Co-workers.  Rest of Nike is great!
cons:
The management is back stabbing and sets people up to fail so they can write you up and get fired.
Always changing shifts to meet the "business needs" which means you can be there for 10+ years and still be sent to Graveyard on a whim.  If they don't like you, you have no chance of a future in Nike Security.  Good luck moving on to other portions of the Security department unless you worked for one of the 3 letter government companies, no matter what your background is.  Do you self a favor and stay away from this department.

pros: Excellent benefits, commitment to self-improvement and time to exercise, fun activities and environment, there's always something going on
cons: I was in a tech role in a non-technical department and I had little support or understanding of my role from my peers. Management training is hit or miss, and while there's a lot of talk about coaching and collaboration, managers don't have a lot of resources for training and strengthening those skills. Pay was low for the level of responsibility I had. Upward mobility was difficult. My manager made it difficult for me to seek opportunities in other areas of the company. I think that was an atypical experience for Nike, though.

review_title: It's cool to say I work at Nike... but it could be cooler.
pros: Great benefits and perks.  Casual dress-code.  Plently of places to play on-site.  Easy to network if you're on the WHQ campus.  There's a career to be made here if you're wanting, willing and able to make it.
cons: Lesser-trained managers.  Developing HR systems.  Rewards often go to biggest heads/loudest voices not best minds/ideas.

review_title: Great Company. The economy caused layoffs that hurt.
pros: Benefits and salaries are good and at least in line with or better than industry. Sharing of information and the opportunity to learn from others is excellent.
cons: Excellent company, but it's unfortunate that all in this industry have taken their manufacturing outside of this country.  But, that tends to be the way with all manufacturing.  Imagine the job growth if we actually manufactured in America some of the things we buy here.

review_title: Great...if you know someone in upper management
pros: Dream job in corporate sales.  Great benefits, bonuses, and discounts. Opened many doors, created long lasting friendships.  Awesome having the name on your résumé.
cons: Total "Boys Club." No one will stand up for you when the going gets tough. Like previous Cons- it's about who you know or grew up with. Management in sales are robots, under qualified and have no style or sense of trends.  Reps work 24-7 with little inspiration, motivation or reward.  Hiring those with zero work history in position is preferred because it's easier to program than to re-program a robot...plus it's cheaper.  Communication is terrible...work load is infinite...deadlines were yesterday.

job_title: Director of Analytics in Beaverton, OR
pros: great campus, cool work environment.
cons: office culture is very political and can tire out the teams, if you come from a big city, Portland is a quite a change and never really got used to it. Also, per the work environment, weekends, nights, it's all about pleasing leadership, and proving your value to remain. Teams often don't collaborate as well, they often try and get their own 'wins' and it  just creates a strange work environment to be a part of. And a culture where they are honesty afraid to fail, anything that wasn't amazing is likely never discussed, not certain how you become that much better if you can't discuss what didn't work.

review_title: Nike is great! Digital Tech is horrible :-(
job_title: Senior Project Manager in Beaverton, OR
pros: Smart people. Best brand in the world. Great amenities for your kids like childcare and swim lessons. Really fast paced and exciting projects. Mark Parker knows what he is doing. Nike is really progressive on gay rights and I loved athlete asterisk, which is if you have a body you are an athlete! You will meet world famous athletes on a fairly regular basis. We have hit bonus every year I have worked here. Nike on your resume opens a lot of doors.
cons: There are some negative middle management individuals in Digital Tech that are creating a war path behind them. Chris Satchell has a good vision and is a good leader, but I don't know how quickly he can root out a culture of hiding information, bullying and sidelining some really good people by a few very bad apples. It's a total boys network. If you work in Digital Tech, it's like you are second class citizen and that makes me sad for Nike. They never promote within. It's total chaos, but it is kind of stablizing over time. You will work overnights and very long hours to make up for management's lack of pro-active planning in earlier phases of projects. Nike is a "yes" culture, so there is not any true prioritizing of road maps--they just abuse employees to get it all done. They are quick to remind you that Nike gets 20,000 resumes every day and you are completely disposable. Digital Tech recycles contractors as a way of having fall guys for full time employees that do not perform.

pros: Great campus, and opportunity to enjoy good facilities. Certain departments have excellent opportunities for growth and employees in those areas receive appropriate remuneration and are enabled to create significant value.
cons: Inefficient, non-standard processes, slow to change. Managers do not understand what they manage. Huge disparity in remuneration, and only small annual increases no matter how much work is put in, how vital the work is or how your role changes. Management takes all credit for the good, even when not involved, but pass down their failings; lack of good work ethic and leadership, and overall focus on pet projects. Passive aggressive bullying takes a toll. Penny wise and pound foolish. Those excellent at the job are pigeon-holed, those who are not are promoted out.

review_title: No Consequences for Lifers.  No Room for Growth for the Rest.
pros: Absolutely love the benefits, stock purchase plan, and campus.
cons: Managers are very set in their ways and feel it's inconvenient to make changes.  If you're young, driven, and eager to grow, expect to work twice as hard for half the pay of your senior co-workers.  If you're a lifer and have been doing the same job for 15 years, congrats on getting away with doing the bare minimum and getting a bigger raise than the rest of us.  There are no consequences and no rewards.

job_title: Part Time Sales Associate in New York, NY
pros: People that you meet that are working with you are some of the best. I have made life time connections there for sure. You are in an environment with very passionate people, for the most part and you all have a love of sport in common.
cons: Claim to hire from within but starting in retail it is a very selective few that move up. A lot of micromanaging and false hope. I know people who worked there longer than me that never had the opportunity to show their talents and skills in the work place.

job_title: Part Time Sales Associate in Simpsonville, KY
pros: Great pay and bonuses every three months. The company is great about telling you what they expect from you and always keeping an upbeat environment.
cons: Not getting time you request off even if its months ahead of time

review_title: Great company who has lost their way a bit....
pros: Lots of benefits, campus in beaverton is beautiful, fun company to work for, discounts on product, free coffee, work/life balance can be good with right manager.
cons: Boys club, cost of services on campus is expensive, lack of keeping true to original principles, lack of middle management in right places and poor review process. Men receive higher pay for same positions. No HR present to assist employees. Managers are backed 100%.

review_title: Sports Mecca, Cream of the Crop
pros: Great campus.  Great product and marketing.  Company is growing.  Company makes great business decisions.
cons: Lots of people on our team that really do not appreciate working for a great company and do not put forth a solid effort.  This is a problem if you thrive in a team environment.

review_title: Harsh place, not for the weak
pros: Competitive atmosphere can lead to superior accomplishments. Nike has an ethos of  keeping everyone at top efficiency, at least sometimes.
cons: Too much bait and switch when it comes to promises made of improved equipment and working conditions.  Totally political and unfair treatment of employees when it comes to raises. It's basically a high school frat-rat and Mean girls corporate culture. Disgusting!

job_title: Sales Associate in Osage Beach, MO
pros: I loved working at Nike. Not only was the 30% off factory store purchases and 40% off Nike Town purchases, amazing. But the work atmosphere was too. A very team oriented atmosphere. The managers at my store were always willing to go above and beyond to help me with anything I needed. Nike gives you all the tools you need to be a successful sales person for their company. The managers are very knowledgable of the product, and in turn so are the employees. This was the perfect place to start my first retail job at.
cons: During the slow season it sometimes got boring from running out of tasks to do.

job_title: Senior Business Systems Analyst in Beaverton, OR
pros: Some really nice and talented folks working at Nike.  Most expertise are from folks that have been there forever,  need to start moving contractors to regular positions.
cons: Poor project department management and direction...run the IT dept. on the back of contractors with a very shoddy and limited on- boarding process.!  For a company that is sooooo large and have very complex business processes, more precises and repeatable processes.

pros:
Competitive pay
Great benefits 
Employees are valued and taken care of
Many opportunities in different directions if you apply yourself. There simply seems as if there is no ceiling.
Review pay mid year to make sure every employee is aligned with states pay rates.
Offers internships to Nike employees that are students
Invests money to ensure they give to the community
cons:
Very competitive to advance. 
Politics are fierce. Must be able to shake hands and kiss babies that's for sure.
Requires a very outgoing type of person to advance the meek get left behind.

review_title: Great company / great people / but terrible management
pros:
-Amazing colleagues 
-Laid back company 
-You can get promoted if you do very well
-Flexible hours
-Care about their employees.
cons:
-Daily routine: you are pretty much doing the same thing everyday especially if you work as a sales assistant (Nike athlete) inside a factory store. 
-If you don't like selling and being inside a store day after day then this is not the right job for you.

review_title: Not the worst retail job in the world.
pros: The discounts are pretty awesome. Being a part, albeit a very very small part, of such a cultural powerhouse with its extensive history is a cool feeling as well. You get 2 shirts and 2 pairs of basketball shorts/pants for free every 90 days, and a free pair of shoes every 6 months while you work there.
cons: The pay is really low. Very frustrating to find out a new hire gets paid more than those who have been around for over a year.

review_title: The Good The Bad and the Swoosh
job_title: Senior Account Representative in Beaverton, OR
pros: Great benefits, access to world class workout facilities, and the discount is hard to beat.
cons: The benefits and discounts don't compensate for the lack of leadership and professional development that is not provided consistently across the entire company. In many areas employees are often babysat by people that love power and being called "manager" Nike knows that everyone wants to work there by the thousands of resume submitted per position. Having this market power allows them to often greatly underpay for talent because its next man up mentality. Outside of VPs, directors and the higher positions the brand has more priority than their employees that actually make it successful.

pros: The discount is by far the best part of working for Nike. It's even more awesome that you get discounts at Converse and Hurly as well. It's a basic retail job, but the technologies that each store has are ahead of most other retail companies which makes the job easier. In my 2 years with the company it was rare that people didn't get along.
cons: Don't expect to move up in the company quickly. People who come to work here tend to stay here forever. In my 2 years of working for Nike I never met anyone who moved from a store to corporate, and less than a handful that moved from sales associate to store management.

review_title: Entry level manufacturing not worth your time or effort
pros: Discounts on Nike products, if that's your thing. Condensed work week (3 on-4 off, 4 on-3 off).
cons: The pay sucks (just over minimum wage when all other manufacturers in the area start out at least $3 more per hour). No sick time, cost of company insurance is high, treated unfairly compared to salaried employees. Little room for advancement unless you are buddy-buddy with those higher up than you.

pros:
Nike, Inc. has wonderful benefits for all, individuals and families. The match to the 401k is great, and the stock options are fantastic. 
The campus is a home away from home, and Nike, Inc. promotes internal movement in order to develop a maximized, rounded employee.
cons:
The campus is so very large, and the provided transportation around campus could be improved upon, if not just in amount of available options. The bikes have been a marked improvement.
There is crowding, however, the campus has been going through a tremendous rebuild and expansion and I think it will be alleviated.

pros: Amazing company with awesome benefits. Free clothes and lots of opportunity in the community. Easy work, and easy to be good at it. Work hard and it will easily show. You get to meet lots of famous athletes and celebrities.
cons: The only way to move up is to wait a few years, or be willing to relocate. The management is not willing to listen to any new ideas and long time employees will gang against you if you tend to make their work ethic look less than it should be.

review_title: Nike is great company. This store is not.
job_title: Sales Associate in Bossier City, LA
pros:
-Get to work for a strong & great company 
-Great NIKE discount
cons:
-Horribly managed store
-Top Management at this store doesn't care at all about their employees
-Only care about achieving their numbers, don't care about thoughts or ideas of employees
-Treat employees like a means to an end & like dirt
-Management are not open to ideas from employees to improve store
-Management thinks they are better than everyone because they have a higher position in the company

review_title: "Innovation is our Key" A thriving company that keeps growing.
pros: Innovative, constantly growing company.  Positive environment and people with passion for the brand. A lot of growth opportunity.  Real team feeling.  Shorts and t-shirts all day.  Good Work/Life balance.  Youth is the energy to the company and work staff.  Always going to "Do the Right Thing." Good communication as a company.  Great people to work with and for.
cons: Upper management is 50/50, some good some bad. Still learning and doesn't have the answers to everything.  New to Retail so still need to implement policies for retail sector.

review_title: Great College paycheck, terrible post-graduate benefits
pros: If you are fortunate enough to work for a new Nike location the training program will bring you much closer to your co-workers and it is fun to learn about Nike from the inside. Nike really is a fascinating company with an intriguing history.
cons: If you miss the opening training the training experience is not nearly as friendly and new comers can feel overwhelmed after being thrown into the fray with athleisure shoppers

review_title: Avoid the Information Security team at Nike
pros:
- Good work life balance
- Some genuinely nice people still there
- Nike discounts
cons:
- Management has no strategic or technical understanding of the products and are unqualified for their role creating a chaotic and non-productive work environment
- Promotions are completely based on popularity and favoritism. Years of experience or delivery means nothing on this team.
- Attrition is through the roof. They lost almost all their actual talent and morale is low for those remaining.
- No accountability. If someone is doing a poor job they are simply moved to another team  or even promoted due to personal favoritism.
- You won't learn anything to progress your career or knowledge.

review_title: Great place if you fit with the culture
pros: visionary company.  great products.  culture can be really positive and inspirational.  always exciting.  great brand.  good benefits.
cons: you have to fit with this specific culture.  straight talking is frowned upon and diplomacy is favored.  people are very nice, but they will not tell you in a straightforward way if you are off track - the emphasis on diplomacy means that it is tough to know where you stand.  if you want to progress within the company there is very little balance and a lot of time away from home.  nike is the priority and there is very little room for anything else in your life.  i left a few years ago but there were not a lot of women in senior management.  even though i believe that entry level starts out at 50/50 in terms of ratio men to women, the highest levels of senior leadership weren't over 25%.  the dropoff is concerning.  i don't know if that has changed since i left though.  overall, it seemed that if you were in with the powers that be, then you were set, seemingly regardless of your actual contributions.  if you were not in favor with the right people, your work didn't matter.  also people changed jobs so frequently, it seemed that if you are concerned about making long term decisions it might not be helpful to your career.  or alternatively, you were likely to end up holding a role and cleaning up for someone who made short sighted decisions that made them look good, but then the next person had to clean up and the next person didn't look so good because the bad decision maker was already on to a bigger job.

pros: Most of the people you will work with are awesome and there to help.  Discounts at the company store aren't too bad .
cons: Very long hours, low pay and watch out for the sharks.  It is a shark tank so don't bleed.  Lots of people who will say one thing and then do something the opposite.  Also be prepared that once you reach a certain age of years with Nike they will lay you off.  Lay off's occur every 5-7 years.  Top management will claim they know nothing about it but they most likely do.  It is a big boys club.

pros:
Awesome co-workers
Nike run-club
Free staff dress
Good discount
Opportunity to network and meet people from all around the world
cons:
Unstable working hours
Store managers are on a high horse
Late working hours

I don't believe I have ever been so disrespected in a 'professional' working environment. Store manager, Assistant store manager, and some people who work in operations are always on a high horse and fail to respect employees. Upper management needs A LOT of work! You will stay as late as 11P.M if you close. Can be dangerous walking the downtown streets at the hour by yourself.

pros: Very flexible working hours, gym on campus which you can go to whenever you like. Friendly environment yet with a university campus feel.
cons:
Boys club rules. Who you know and your social abilities matter to a great degree - usually more than the quality of work. 
It's a sports company and that shows - games are played often. I just wish they would be more explicit about the rules.

review_title:
Floor rep and customer service
I cleaned I took I cover other peoples shifts ask for more work neve get a job related.
pros: Icons worry about that job with that I got the make very good social skills and it made me be able to talk better appropriately and I can actually just keep going at my own pace and comfortably.
cons: Because we're about the job with very little pay not the best workers not the best neighborhood nor were the people who were higher than you always good to you and gave you your right schedule

job_title: Full-Time Footwear Athlete in Portland, OR
pros: Great employee discount, employee store is only 20 minutes away with special exclusive releases and 50% discount. Over $5000 a year in tuition assistance for Full-Time or higher. Escalating Paid-Time Off based on length of employment and status. Great coworkers and leaders and ample opportunities for advancement
cons: Fast-Paced work environment with a very demanding set of expectations. While there are many opportunities to shine in the company, if you are unable to finish your task (regardless of whether completion was even possible) then you have 3+ coaches who seek to understand why you couldn't finish and who will coach you to improve. Also going into overtime is a big no-no, even if they schedule you at 40 hours and overtime is 40.01 hours

job_title: Part Time Sales Associate in Hyderābād
pros: Nike Chicago was great because every day was different. You would always meet different people including celebs and every day was different. Also the employees were great and you can meet lots of great friends. Lastly the 40 percent discount was amazing.
cons: lots of butt kissers, everyone is trying to get to the top, people need to chill, communication was very poor. If you were seasonal you were very disposible. Every one there is doing the bare minimum work and throwing people under the bus to get a promotion.

job_title: Part Time Sales Associate in New York, NY
pros:
As an employee, there is a 40% off discount. 
One of the most fun things about working in the retail location is that your job is to serve the customer The customer interaction is the best part about the job. Sometimes you can be speaking with someone famous and never know who it is, until they introduce themselves. Its the customer interaction that makes the job fun.
cons: Management often times are really unprofessional and not fair. They have high expectations and produce low results. In addition, there is a glass ceiling in regards to moving up. If you have a vision of going from retail to corporate, prepare to work harder than you expect.... And that's if they like you.

pros: Nike technology is a great place to work.  Nike is building a cutting edge and innovative technology team.  I really enjoy the work I do.  Being at a growth company provides many opportunities for growth.
cons: Nike is growing fast and the locations employees work at are being spread further and further apart.  This makes it hard to continue to network and build alignment within a company.

pros: Great teammates - everybody wants to do great work and is willing to go All In on a project.  Good benefits.  Exciting brand.
cons: Culture is shifting - Nike's losing some of the things that made it so special.  Leadership lacks direction and team development is only as good as the individual leader.  Focus on top leader perks creates a significant class division between the "haves" and "have nots".

pros: Nike is a competitive place to work, but manages to find a balance between family and work. Great place for me to work at and I would recommend it to my friends
cons:
Nike is always changing. If you don't like constantly changing and challenging yourself in new ways, maybe this is not for you. 
Another thing is that Nike is a self-promotion company. In other words, you will seldom get rewarded with promotions etc. if you dont make it known that you are willing, able and ready to grow.

review_title: Diversified colleagues & culture; outlook from the management; health growing company
pros: A good work-life balance; so diversified colleagues and always new things to learn; always like a sponge; the company cares for your career development.
cons: You have to adapt yourself to the work environment ASAP; try to network as much as possible, which will help your work.

pros: Solid Brand allows ability to attract good talent.  Great pay, no P&L accountability.  Just make sales and keep team happy.
cons: lack of processes and policies creates extreme challenges in keeping fairness and consistency among team, which stifles Leadership credibility among staff.  HR support does not exist on any level except regional - and that is one person....response time unacceptable to attain results.

pros: The campus has the right amenities. Employee benefits are average amoung other large companies. If you like to socialize, this is definitely the right place to work.
cons: Too many collaborative meetings.  NIke offers "stretch" assignments for those interested in moving into other career areas, however these assignments are are infrequent and usually only provided to a chosen few.

review_title: A great way to experience a large multinational corporation with a real focus of brand experience and cultural identity.
pros: I tell people that I could be doing my job anywhere, but the fact that I get to do it at Nike makes all the difference. the work culture and attention to keeping the brand experience relevant and central are second to none. There is a high amount of energy constantly flowing through the campus.This energy is coupled with a laid back atmosphere consisting of jeans and running shoes for work attire allowing for a sustainable work environment that keeps you going without burning you out too quickly. Even though there are a large amount of people working at the main campus it still feels like a small town in that you regularly see senior management walking about and still feel like you're in the thick of current Nike events and cultural milestones.
cons: While the culture at Nike is well known for being vibrant and energetic it can be taken too far too often. the phrase "that's a great first step" is used regularly. The meaning behind it is that while you may be doing a great job there is always room for improvement.  While the heart of this sentiment is genuine and productive it can breed a certain level of paranoia relating to one's self worth within the context of contribution to the company. You may never feel like you're doing well enough at your job and start to feel at risk of loosing it. With Nike's popularity, there's always someone willing to do you're job if you don't wan it or can't handle it. I have noticed several instances where the "there's always more to be done" mindset is taken too far and the work life balance that Nike advertises is thrown to one side.

pros: Very team oriented, you get bonuses for going over budgets for that day, room for advancement in the company
cons: Not enough hours to actually make a difference paycheck wise. When it is off months, you are lucky to get $200 for 2 weeks worth of work! Definitely not the job for someone who is trying to live off of one job! Even when they dont have the hours to give out to their current employees, they will still hire new people! We cant survive in the month of September & October on 12 hours a week!

pros: Generally laid back with nice people. They pay pretty well once you add in the bonus and benefits. Depending on your director they have flex time and regular telecommuting days. They are big and very stable.
cons: Nike is very inconsistent with regards to directors, some being very good while others horrible. You start with only 3 weeks combined vacation and sick time (decent directors allow you to work from home when sick to help mitigate this). Some teams have the one-up mentality of staying late.

review_title: Mixed - love it and hate it simultaneously. For a corporation, it's amazing.
pros: The work environment is casual and there are lots of little perks (product, snacks, company-sponsored parties/events, discounts), an amazing and beautiful campus to come to every day. There are a lot of intelligent, ambitious and entrepreneurial types of people to work alongside. The CEO is amazing with an untarnished and highly-regarded reputation around campus.
cons:
The parking and commute is a total nightmare - Portland and Beaverton traffic is extremely congested every single morning and evening and working from home is not an option on my team. The cafeteria food is overpriced and uninspiring. While the people are some of the best I've ever worked with, too many people are self-absorbed and full of themselves and have the attitude/demeanor that they're saving the world while looking oh-so stylish. It's actually quite entertaining when it's not completely nauseating. 
A lot of waste happens at Nike - from massive amounts of product waste to extravagant & ridiculous spending amongst some teams, VP parking spots that sit empty while the rest are packed like sardines everywhere else, travel plans that change on a dime (and significant dollars lost in the process), and so on. 
Very difficult to push through the glass ceiling and walls at Nike.

review_title: An amazing company - it's on you to make it work for you
pros: Bright minds; inspiring work to be done. Free gym membership to some of the best sports facilities there are. New buildings, huge range of delicious food options. A culture of coaching and developing employees. It has all the things.
cons: WHQ is GIANT. You can easily get lost in the machine. It can be complex, overwhelming, and feel so big as to be impersonal. Lots of busy people packed in back-to-back meetings, bustling around trying to impress one another and forgetting to be personal and human. It's up to all of us to create the culture we want.

pros: The reason's to work at Nike are: retail discounts, sample sales, a resort-like campus with amenities like bank machines, gift shops, dry cleaners, restaurants and state of the art gym facilities. And the occasionally sighting of an Athlete visiting campus.
cons: Nike spend tens....likely hundreds of millions wooing college athletics across the nation. Focused only  on driving its brands deeper into the mind sight of every athletic.  Nike feels it's more important to strive for dominance than building a workforce of highly capable professionals.

job_title: Sales Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
1st class organization that is a leader in the athletic industry.
Have the opportunity to meet some great people including the best athletes from all over the world.   It's easy to take pride in the products you are manufacturing and selling.  Discounted and free items and the free health clubs.
cons:
With so many employees, it makes it very difficult to get promoted.
There are several large offices to compete with when looking for a promotion.  Nike doesn't have to pay top dollar for employees because so many people will take less money to work for a proven leader in the industry.

review_title: Nike is an incredible place for work life balance and fun
job_title: Business Systems Analyst Intern in Beaverton, OR
pros: The work Life balance is incredible. Nike also has a VERY open door policy. The upper leadership is interested in your success and willing to take time to sit down and talk about your goals.  The pride people feel working for Nike is unprecedented.
cons: The pay is far below industry standards and it can be difficult to get dicisions made. If you are a type A personality it can be frustrating. The motto just do it often spills into the dicision making process and can leave a mess to fix later.

review_title: Best sales associate job you can get as a young adult
job_title: Part-Time Over Athlete in New York, NY
pros:
Great discount for anyone into sports gear
Sports-driven environment
Awesome co-workers from all backgrounds
Cool Nike events here and there
cons:
Not much room for growth outside of retail store
Requires super-open availability on weekends (I understand weekends are the busiest but don't require us to work Friday-Sunday if you can afford it)

job_title: Studio Lead in Newport Beach, CA
pros: Nike is the greatest company in the world, they do things that no other company can do. Working for Nike is great if it is your hobby, if you are looking for a future with this company, good luck.
cons: They do not promote or provide adequate growth opportunities, employees are given false hope about being able to accomplish their dreams. You are not compensated as much as you should be for the work they expect of you.

pros: Fun fast paced environment. Mostly pleasant customers. Young company don't think there was anyone much over 35 years old on staff.
cons: Poor training borderline inadequate. Do not care about employees. Not flexible with scheduling. Constantly understaffed on weekends. Hiring new employees at a higher pay rate than employees who have worked there 2+ years.

job_title: Full Stack Engineer in Portland, OR
pros:
- Nike isn't a tech company, but is dedicating lots of resources to it. Lots of people internally will say "it's like working at a really well funded start-up!"
- The transition to pure agile means resources dedicated to teach employees, and even paying for them to become certified scrum developers.
cons: - As far as working in technology, there are clear separations of interest from the main organization to different orgs and groups. Resources flow to CDT and not Nike Tech (the internal tools portion of technology). Resources also flow to products that make more money and are more consumer facing.

review_title: A large community and industry potential
pros:
You are immediately connected to a large network of prestigious companies and directors that can give you precious information and fast track your career. It's a very challenging environment, such a huge brand requires that targets are met every time. I learned that level of discipline when working in Sales in London with Boyd Parker. Always pushed me to focus on my actions rather than results, and built my confidence levels.
With Nike, it's the same, focus on the simple tasks I can achieve and results come along easily.
cons: It's a large organisation, it's easy to feel lost at first. Always remember the people you meet and you can build up from there.

job_title: Graphic Design Intern in Beaverton, OR
pros: The Nike campus is an unreal place to work. As an intern i felt my ideas and contributions were valued and i quick was place in a posisiton where I was doing day to day work, as opposed to busy work. You receive a lot of free Nike product also and pay is better than most design internships.
cons: There seems to be a level of clique-i-ness on the campus where certain groups and accounts that work on high profile projects receive way more attention than others.

review_title: Great Place to Work, Terrible Pay and Advancement Opportunities
pros:
Great environment to work in
Great people and teams to work with - nobody is too high up to talk to
Sports oriented attitudes and work environment
Beautiful campus and great facilities
Opportunity for Lateral Growth and learning is high
Good benefits and retirement package
cons:
Very low pay in comparison to other industries
Very low opportunity for upward growth
Terrible process for performance reviews that fails to recognize solid performance

pros:
Great Atmosphere
Great Uniform
Great Discount on nike products and Affiliated companies
Great Wages..What more can you ask for in a Job
cons: Sometimes you get scheduled for days you request off, even if you requested in the time you were alotted. I guess this means bad management. And there was really no solution for the influx of customers we would get, it would just be huge battlefield especially during the weekends which made working pretty stressful and there is a lot of international customers so the language barrier could sometimes be a problem too

review_title: Amazing place to drive into work everyday.
pros:
Pride that comes with working for one of the most admirable brands on the planet.
Surrounded by talented, passionate people.
Cool travel that includes stays at top hotels in great cities....because you're expected to stay trend away and connected to your consumer.
Fun co-workers
Great product discounts and direct access to the employee store!
cons:
Too many people work there now, so many people that you can get lost in the matrix
Political, must be one of the cool kids to play the game
Working there can "dumb down" your skills because no one person ever makes a decision and thus who really is accountable?

review_title: passionate, hard working people, top notch product, really proud of my time there.
pros: the people, the work, the product-- all world class.  hard to compete with the environment-- the campus, the gym, the cafeterias, etc. that enhance the work, the projects and delivering to the consumer.
cons: remember, Nike is a Company....  and while you may be totally invested in it, the company may not be invested in you.  Be smart- make good moves and remember not to keep all your eggs in one basket-- develop outside interests, friends, dry-cleaners.

job_title: Senior Data Warehouse Engineer in Beaverton, OR
pros: Great Benefits! 401k match, stock purchase program, list goes on...
cons: They expect you to work 60+ hours a week.  If you are work in IT...don't come here!! They have no direction, they say they are progressive and they are not.  I wish they were agile, but politics hold them up on everything.  They have no good senior IT leads because everyone good leaves because they can't get anything implemented.  The systems are so scattered, they would rather say they got something done by a date then give a care on how well it was implemented.

job_title: Sales Associate in New York, NY
pros:
40% discount on all products
co workers make the work environment better
can take part of many nike  sponsered events
can meet great people that enter the store  
provided with staff dress 
good for college student
cons:
rude customers (expected in retail)
there are two types of part times, part time under and part time over and part under can't get more than 20 hours a week, and sometimes we aren't even give the full 20 hours. 
big turnover rate
constantly changing rules
devices used to do transactions always lose connection
PAY is pretty low for a store around fifth ave

pros:
-Full benefits for employees who pass the initial ninety day probation period. 
-Management team is on top of everything 
-Developing advanced product knowledge, gaining communication skills, and developing sales skills. 
-Flexible hours besides weekends which are mandatory.
cons: -Management team is good, but there are usually like 8 managers that work a day. One will tell you to do something, and as your doing it you'll run into another while your still trying to complete the first task. Still very easy to work/get along with!

review_title: Great vision, great brand, too big...
pros: The campus is awesome and most of the people are great.  The overall culture is exciting and creative.  Every time I walk by Mark Parker, he says hello; so amazing!
cons:
With big companies come big problems...the culture becomes fragmented where one group can be the antithesis of another, i.e. one group might have a very command and control driven hierarchy, where another empowers employees.

It can also be hard to rise through the ranks into the upper echelon; seems to be more hiring externally than building up leadership internally.

review_title: Nike has become a BIG company
pros: Great physical work environment.  Campus offers opportunity to work across functions and regions.
cons: Nike has become too big to care about their employees.  Managers are focused on the bottom line at the expense of employee development.

pros: Nike Maxims and core values are ones to be admired. Very good quality of life in the workplace. Managers that give you tools to succeed. A lot of networking opportunities if you play your cards right. Very decent pay for part timers who are still in school.
cons: A lot of promise for growth but when one is ready there is a lot of push back. Managers, although they invest in you, Work you too hard to make sure you're loyal to the brand. Causes disdain for the company and many people look for other opportunity because of it.

pros: You work in a really upbeat and fast paced environment. Managers are very supportive and will offer you plenty of help when you need it. You also have plenty of autonomy while you work, which makes work much more enjoyable. The discount is also pretty amazing at 40% off at retail or 30% off at outlet locations.
cons: It seems difficult to more from retail to a corporate level position. Stretch assignments seem to help, but do not guarantee anything unless you build a solid relationship with the managers who you are working the assignment with.

pros: It was a fast-paced, fun experience for the summer. Nike encourages a team atmosphere, which makes organizing endless piles of t-shirts more enjoyable. The management encourages healthy competition with neighboring Nike stores, in terms of sales, customer satisfaction, and visitor numbers.
cons: I can't really think of many negative factors to this job. It provided everything I was looking for, within the time period that I had desired.

pros: Nike has always been a very fun and friendly environment since day one in my book! The hours are  flexible. There is a great deal of potiential for promotions. (One has to truly voice and exert interest in building a career with the company.) Formulate a career path for yourself and go for it! If you are just branching out into the workforce, Nike is a great place for professional growth. If hired, you of course will have access to your 30% off discount. The interview isn't difficult, but do yourself a favor and come prepared.
cons: Rude customers and the temperature inside of some stores can get a bit cold at times.

pros: Good benefits, discounts, and awesome co workers!
cons: I love the brand, Nike is a great company. However, the management at the factory store was horrible!!! If you live in KY I strongly advise you not to work at the  Nike Outlet in Simpsonville, unless they get new management. There is a lot favoritism and disrespect from management, they do not value their employees. Because of the poor leadership, many athletes quit and managers left. You were not able to get weekends off unless you requested them off and often times your request were denied because the store was under staffed. It was unfortunate such a great brand had horrible management at thier factory store.

pros: meeting new people. friendships. lovely coworkers. events. discounts.
cons: favoritism. lack of morals. people quitting every week. upper management lacked actual management skills.  if working on the retail side, you will feel very disrespected and overworked. almost every other week i was set up to work a weeks worth of overnight shifts. they never cared that i was in school either. insurance here is not that great either. they expect you to put nike first. if something happened to come up, or if you had class or other conflicts they'd expect you to put nike before anything else. i could hardly ever flex my schedule if i had to go to a doctors appointment. i guess my health was not important to them.

review_title: Great Company But Store Management Sucks!
pros: Honestly, Nike is a great company outside of the store. The benefits are great and who can beat the 40% discount.
cons: Upward movement within the company is very hard at the store level. Management has there favorites and only look out for them.

pros: Nike has a lot of energetic employees working there.  Most of the employees have a great attitude and are very excited to be at work.  Nike is a fun brand to work around and a lot of the customers are just as excited as the employees.
cons: Nike retail is a good place to work but it can tire you out.  Customers are not always polite or considerate of your job.

pros: Loved the Training the gave me, I learned many things I did not know about Nike. I feel really good when I talk to customers and explined their function and when they take the product I am pleased to see that leaving the store with what they wanted.
cons: For me there is no disadvantage, all positions on the team are excellent. It is better to work together.Only I work a season and I was disappointed. I keep asking because I have big goals in this company and would like to run a store.

pros: Fun enviroment, always engaged in sports. You truly do feel like an athlete working at NIKE. The discount is CRAZY! 40% off online ANYTHING, 30% off instore which was fantastic b/c there are always sales going on at Nike factory outlet stores. People are good to work with as well, might make lifetime friends.
cons: Any shift over 5hrs requires you take a 1 hour break. Which is stupid b/c you are there longer. Work/balance is okay, its easy to swap shifts with people if they're up for it. Really the main con i can think of, is having to stand all day. Can be hard to move up also.
